column4: I'm just going to up a suggestion out there for future development. Something seriously has to be done with updatedb and apt-xapian-index, i.e. clear and user friendly options to turn these things off rather than, for instance having to edit cron stuff. Between updatedb and apt-xapian-index this evening, my computer was essentially useless for 30 minutes.
I wasnt aware updatedb ran automatically...
is updatedb really a cron job?
It is referenced in the daily.cron file. DasEL: That sounds about right. However, with this apt-xapian-index running also, it really does a double-wammy.
